subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Documentation and Names
msgSnippet: ... Each test runs as a TestCase object. You don t put test cases together into a TestCase; you put them into a TestCase /class/, which is a blueprint for
messageBody:
Curt Sampson wrote:
> On Fri, 19 Mar 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > I understand the documentation is old. That's why Mike Clark and I each
> > wrote well-known, widely-read tutorials on JUnit. They just aren't in
> > the JUnit distribution.
>
> Well, documentation aside, I find the naming of the classes throws me
> off a bit. When I think of a test case, I think of a single test, such
> as one testXXX method. Several of these can be put together into a
> test suite, but in JUnit you put these test cases together not into a
> TestSuite but into a TestCase. Hmmm....

Each test runs as a TestCase object. You don't put test cases together
into a TestCase; you put them into a TestCase /class/, which is a
blueprint for TestCases. Isn't that elementary OOP?
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
